alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 11:57AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Recent warm temperatures and upstream dam releases will continue to result in increased river flows. For the South Fork of the Ogden River near Huntsville...Near moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and will continue. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet (992 CFS), low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. At 5.5 feet (1599 CFS), low lying areas adjacent to the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive moderate flood damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 4.8 feet (1138 CFS). - The river stage is decreasing this morning but remains above moderate flood stage. River stage will increase through late Thursday to early Friday before decreasing gradually over the next 7 to 10 days. - Forecast...The river will rise to near moderate flood stage again by Thursday morning and above minor flood stage through at least May 26. - Flood stage is 4.6 feet (992 cfs). &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 1200 MDT on Thursday.
